explanation: [0-0] The screen is divided into three sections, with gray backgrounds in the upper and lower sections. In the middle section, a man wearing a beige work uniform and gloves stands in front of a blue pipe coiling machine, guiding a stainless steel pipe through the rollers. He is in a steel-structured factory building, with many metal structures behind him and steel pipes piled up on the ground.

[0-9] The steel pipe is quickly bent into a circle. The man puts his left hand on the steel pipe and walks to the back left as the steel pipe is bent into circles, disappearing from the screen while the steel pipe continues to be bent. Subsequently, the camera cuts and the man reappears in front of the coiling machine. He tilts his head to look back, with a pair of goggles hanging on the back of his head. The steel pipe on the machine has been coiled into a tall pile of steel pipe rings. The man turns his head and pulls the steel pipe with his left hand, and the steel pipe continues to be coiled and stacked up in circles.
